instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 - No orange light. Major liquid spill, chimes ok.
threads.message:
So board has visible signs of liquid almost everywhere but not much corrosion. Most of the liquid was maybe around U7000.

It turns on and gives me an green light, no orange and runs off the battery no problem. Can also turn on/off when just on battery.

U7000::17/18 & 27/28 measure as expected.

R5280 & R5281 are in spec and show 3.4v

threads.title: 820-3115 - No orange light. Major liquid spill, chimes ok.
threads.message:
Suddenly getting an orange light now...

Seems like it takes a while for the orange light to turn on. Around 30seconds maybe a minute.

threads.title: 820-3115 - No orange light. Major liquid spill, chimes ok.
threads.message: Could be corrosion under SMC or battery connector....

threads.title: 820-3115 - No orange light. Major liquid spill, chimes ok.
threads.message: PPBUS voltage is the first thing to check!
